title: So your Santa Clause
content:
Who earned a lump of coal in His/Her stocking or the dream gift.

As for me George W. and Cheney and Rice have earned a coal mine each, let alone a lump.

 [‹ Happy New Year!](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180811/http:/typophile.com/node/17034 "Go to previous forum topic") [So, what did you get? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180811/http:/typophile.com/node/16962 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Dan Weaver

comments.content:
Once upon a time there was a land of the free, now it is just a fairy tale memory.

ChrisL
I only asked for ~4 type books because I have no other material wants really this year, I suspect that I will be getting them and enjoying my new base of knowledge once finished reading them!

Dave who deserves good gifts other than you. I vote for Chris and Norbert for different reasons. Chris always has a humourous view of the world and Norbert is putting his effort into education. Good guys both. But hey I’m an older guy too and thats my perspective. Come on younger guys and gals: who are your heros this year!

Hmmm yeah, I totally zoned out on the idea of the thread. My parents deserve an amazing gift for giving me the opportunity of living in Manhattan for 6 months on co-op. I just don’t know what to get them...and money is pretty short since I don’t get paid at work.

I second your motion, Dan. These two guys are tip top in contributions to this community both intellectually and educationally.

Thank you Dan. I am truly humbled. To me, the true heros who really deserve our praise are the ordinary folk who have very little of their own but still give what they can to those less fortunate. Some volunteer time at soup kitchens, others pass out blankets to the homeless who have nothing but a steaming grate to keep them warm. They don’t get recognition for their work, they just do it because it is right.

ChrisL

Awwhh shucks, Dan!  
Kind words, but as Chris said, there are plenty of people doing some real good out there... thank heavens.

As for my Santa, he’s already came and went dropping off a little bundle we call Joey!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080628180811im_/http:/typophile.com/files/image002.jpg)

Just look at those discerning eyes and skeptical smirk... the Florendo genes live on!

” the Florendo genes live on!”

I don’t know Norbert, Joey is WAY cuter than you :-)

ChrisL

IMHO, the Guardian redesign was the typographic event of the year. (Notwithstanding TYPECON of course!)
